Container.Name: TimeMachine
Container.Requires:
You will need to set the filesystem permissions on disk. By default, the timemachine user is 1000:1000.
Granting Permissions to write to the directory can be achieved by executing the following command on the host (Unraid): sudo chown -R 1000:1000 /mnt/user/timemachine/
The backing data store for your persistent time machine data must support extended file attributes (xattr). Usually for shares in the Unraid Array this is not a problem. Remote file systems, such as NFS, will very likely not support xattrs. This image will check and try to set xattrs to a test file in /opt/${TM_USERNAME} to warn the user if they are not supported but this will not prevent the image from running.
Also note that if you change the User Name (TM_USERNAME) value that it will change the data path for backup data inside of the container from /opt/timemachine to /opt/value-of-TM_USERNAME.

Config.Name: Time Machine Backup Data
Config.Description: Directory to store the time machine backups. If you change the User Name (TM_USERNAME) value that it will change the data path from /opt/timemachine to /opt/value-of-TM_USERNAME.

Config.Name: Size Limit
Config.Description:
Limits the reported disksize, thus preventing Time Machine from using the whole real disk space for backup. The option takes a number plus an optional unit (e.g. 1 T for 1 Terrabyte).
IMPORTANT: This is an approximated calculation that only takes into account the contents of Time Machine sparsebundle images. Therefore you MUST NOT use this volume to store other content when using this option, because it would NOT be accounted. The calculation works by reading the band size from the Info.plist XML file of the sparsebundle, reading the bands/ directory counting the number of band files, and then multiplying one with the other.

Config.Name: User Name
Config.Description: sets the username time machine runs as

Config.Name: User Password
Config.Description: sets the password for the timemachine user. The default value is Z92efVNcokU26x.

Config.Name: Advertised Hostname
Config.Description: Avahi will advertise the smb services at this hostname instead of the local hostname

Config.Name: Use Custom SMB Configuration
Config.Description: indicates that you are going to bind mount a custom config to /etc/samba/smb.conf if set to true

Config.Name: Custom User
Config.Description: indicates that you are going to bind mount /etc/password, /etc/group, and /etc/shadow; and create data directories if set to true

Config.Name: Debug Level
Config.Description: sets the debug level for nmbd and smbd

Config.Name: Mimic Model
Config.Description: sets the value of time machine to mimic (e.g. TimeCapsule8,119 or TimeCapsule6,116)

Config.Name: External Configuration Directory
Config.Description: specifies a directory in which individual variable files, ending in .conf. In order to add multiple users who have their own shares, you will need to create a file for each user and put them in a directory.

Config.Name: Hide Shares
Config.Description: set to yes if you would like only the share(s) a user can access to appear

Config.Name: Group Name
Config.Description: sets the group name time machine runs as

Config.Name: User UID
Config.Description: sets the UID of the Executing User (TM_USERNAME)

Config.Name: Set Permissions
Config.Description: set to true to have the entrypoint set ownership and permission on the /opt/ in the container

Config.Name: SMB Inherit Permissions
Config.Description: if yes, permissions for new files will be forced to match the parent folder

Config.Name: SMB fruit:nfs_aces
Config.Description: value of fruit:nfs_aces; support for querying and modifying the UNIX mode of directory entries via NFS ACEs

Config.Name: SMB fruit:metadata
Config.Description: value of fruit:metadata; controls where the OS X metadata stream is stored

Config.Name: SMB Port
Config.Description: sets the port that Samba will be available on

Config.Name: SMB vfs objects
Config.Description: value of vfs objects

Config.Name: SMB Workgroup Name
Config.Description: set the SMB workgroup name

Config.Name: Group GID
Config.Description: sets the GID of the TM_GROUPNAME group

Config.Name: Share Name
Config.Description: sets the name of the timemachine share to.
